definitions.definition: An appointment , especially to speak or perform .
examples: The lecturer has three speaking engagements this week.
Check the gears for full engagement before turning the handle.

definitions.definition: The feeling of being compelled, drawn in, connected to what is happening, interested in what will happen next.
definitions.label_groups: uncountable , by extension , about human emotional state

definitions.definition: The period of time when marriage is planned or promised .
examples: We are enjoying a long engagement , but haven't yet set a date.

definitions.definition: In any situation of conflict , an actual instance of active hostilities .
examples: The engagement resulted in many casualties.

definitions.definition: The point at which the fencers are close enough to join blades, or to make an effective attack during an encounter.
examples: After engagement it quickly became clear which of the fencers was going to prevail.

definitions.definition: A performance metric representing an instance where a user interacts with some content after an impression .

subdefinitions.definition: The quantitative response to a piece of content ; attention .

main_definition: ( countable ) An appointment , especially to speak or perform .
secondary_definitions: ( uncountable , by extension , about human emotional state ) The feeling of being compelled, drawn in, connected to what is happening, interested in what will happen next.
( countable , uncountable ) The period of time when marriage is planned or promised .
( countable , uncountable ) In any situation of conflict , an actual instance of active hostilities .
( fencing , countable ) The point at which the fencers are close enough to join blades, or to make an effective attack during an encounter.
( Internet , countable ) A performance metric representing an instance where a user interacts with some content after an impression .
